climateOverview.title: Global Climate Overview
climateOverview.description: Climate change is affecting the planet in a variety of ways, from increasing global temperatures to more extreme weather events. Understanding the science behind these changes is critical for developing solutions.

emissions.title: Global Emissions
emissions.description: Human activities, particularly the burning of fossil fuels, have led to an increase in greenhouse gas emissions, which are the primary drivers of global warming.

temperatureRise.title: Global Temperature Rise
temperatureRise.description: The average global temperature has increased significantly over the past century, with the most noticeable warming occurring in the last few decades.

renewableEnergy.title: Renewable Energy Growth
renewableEnergy.description: Renewable energy sources, such as wind and solar, are seeing significant growth as we transition away from fossil fuels. This shift is essential for reducing emissions and mitigating climate change.
